text: My Gentleman Friend is a 1961 album by Blossom Dearie. ==Track listing== #"Little Jazz Bird" (George Gershwin, Ira Gershwin) – 3:43 #"Gentleman Friend" (Arnold B. Horwitt, Richard Lewine) – 3:49 #"It's Too Good to Talk About Now" (Cy Coleman, Carolyn Leigh) – 3:09 #"Chez moi" (Jean Féline, Paul Misraki, Bruce Sievier) – 3:09 #"You Fascinate Me So" (Coleman, Leigh) – 3:33 #"You've Got Something I Want" (Bob Haymes) – 2:37 #"Boum" (E. Ray Goetz, Charles Trenet) – 2:10 #"L'étang" (Misraki) – 2:27 #"Hello Love" (Michael Preston Barr, Dion McGregor) – 2:51 #"Someone to Watch Over Me" (G. Gershwin, I. Gershwin) – 5:57 ==Personnel== *Blossom Dearie – vocal (all tracks), piano (all tracks except "You've Got Something I Want") *Kenny Burrell – guitar (all tracks) *Ray Brown – double bass (all tracks) *Ed Thigpen – drums (all tracks) *Bobby Jaspar – flute (on "Chez Moi", "Boum", "L'etang") Category:1961 albums Category:Blossom Dearie albums Category:Verve Records albums Category:Albums produced by Norman Granz
title: My Gentleman Friend
